title: [BUG] Hard crash when using SkiaSharp 2.88.6 with .Net 8 RC2
body:
### Description

As you know, my app has used SkiaSharp to do thumbnail resize ops for years. This week i upgraded from .Net 8 preview 7 to RC2, and as part of that I also upgraded SkiaSharp from 2.88.5 => 2.88.6. Once I'd done that, the app just crashes *hard* when I try and resize images for thumbnails. No exception, no stack traces, just a hard SIGTERM exit and no more process. 

I'll try and debug through and see if I can track down the exact op that fails, but there's definitely something wrong here. :(

### Code

Haven't tracked it down precisely yet, but it's one of the Skia method calls in here: https://github.com/Webreaper/Damselfly/blob/master/Damselfly.Core.ImageProcessing/SkiaSharpProcessor.cs#L25

Hard to find because the debugger doesn't catch the crash. :(

### Expected Behavior

Not crash. ;)

### Actual Behavior

Process vapourised, debugging session ends (in both VS for Mac, and Rider). if running in docker on Linux, the container is shut down. No logs, no exceptions, no stack trace, nothing.
